definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: go free, be unrestrained, overrun, exceed (NH [[סָרוּחַ]] overhanging, flapping; Ar. sarah. of camels, etc., pasture where they please; also send forth to pasture; II. let a wife go free; let down the hair; suruh. easy.—NH [[סָרַח]], Aram. srah. usu. = corrupt, sin);—

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Impf. 3 fs. [[תִּסְרַח]] Ex 26:12; Pt. act. f. [[סׂרַ֫חַת]] Ez Eze 17:6; pass. [[סָרוּחַ]] (cf. Kö:ii. 1, 137 Ges:§ 50 f. Ba:NB 180) Ex 26:13; pl. [[סְרוּחִים]] Am 6:7, [[סְרֻחִים]] v:Am 6:4; cstr. [[סְרוּחֵי]] Ez Eze 23:15; —

go free, be unrestrained: [[וּסְרֻחִים עַל־עַרְשׂוֹתָם]] Am 6:4 i.e. prob. = and are sprawling upon their couches (in contempt. hyperbole), ´[[מִרַזְח ס]] v:Am 6:7 the revelry of sprawlers; pt. act. of overrunning, spreading vine Ez Eze 17:6.

of overhanging stuffs (prop. overrunning, exceeding, extended beyond limits) [[תִּסְרַח עַל אֲחׂרֵי]] [[הַמִּשְׁכָּן]] Ex 26:12 (P) it shall overrun (overhang), over the back of the tabern., so [[יִהְיֶה סָרוּחַ]] ´[[עַל־חִדֵּי הַמּ]] v:Ex 26:13; [[סְרוּחֵי טְבוּלִים]] Ez Eze 23:15 overhung of turbans, extended with respect to turbans, = with pendant turbans (cf. [[[טְבוּל]]]).

definitions.title: Niph.
definitions.body: Pf. 3 fs. [[נִסְרְחָה חָכְמָתָם]] Je 49:7 usu. is their wisdom let loose (i.e. dismissed, gone)? (‖[[הַאֵין עוֹד]] [[חָכְמָה בְּתֵימָָן אָֽבְד עֵחָה מִבַּנִים]]); but Nö:Expos. May, 1897, 363 is corrupt (cf. NH, and esp. Aram.).
